newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Wingtips of Canada, Taiwan 747s collide in Manila.
newsitem.headline: Wingtips of Canada, Taiwan 747s collide in Manila.

text.p: The wing-tips of two B-747 aircraft owned by Canadian Airlines and Taiwan's Eva Air collided at the Manila airport on Sunday but there were no injuries among passengers, airport officials said.

The Vancouver-bound Canadian plane, with 385 people aboard, was being pulled onto the tarmac prior to departure when its wing-tip struck that of the parked Eva Air jet, airport operations manager Rodolfo Dimaano said.

The "winglet" -- a two-metre-long small wing folded upward to stabilise the wing in flight -- of each aircraft was damaged but the Eva Air flight, with 271 poeple aboard, was able to leave later for Taipei.
The Canadian flight 008, whose winglet suffered greater damage, was still grounded for repairs, officials said.
